messages.content: Client is trying to keep the legal bill under $1500. Wants lease reviewed and possibly dissolved corporation. Needs legal risk analysis and a clear proposal.

Hi Kush,

Thanks for your note.

To stay within your $1500 budget, we recommend limiting our scope to reviewing the lease and advising on risk. This would exclude negotiating directly with the landlord. If dissolution appears appropriate, we’ll proceed conditionally.

We'll assess the lease to determine corporate and potential personal liability, confirm the presence of any guarantees, and outline key risks. If dissolution makes sense, we can prepare the required corporate filings and guide you through the wind-up process.

👉 To move forward, please complete our secure intake form: https://onleylaw.cliogrow.com/intake/ab11020c6901bdd5eef2afc09db57c39

Best regards,  
Rob Onley  
Managing Lawyer

Client is incorporating a federal for-profit business related to a charity and wants to raise capital. Also needs a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with the charity and future shareholder agreement. Wants to confirm scope and conflict of interest concerns.

Great speaking with you. Based on our conversation, we’ll support you with the federal incorporation and prepare a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with the NATO Association of Canada to define roles and manage any potential conflict of interest. We’ll also remain available to draft a shareholder agreement as the business develops.
